title: Firefox on Debian 13 with XFCE: Firefox doesn't respect my GTK theme, except if the theme's name ends with "-dark"
content:
Hello,

I just set up a computer with Debian 13 'Trixie', and I downloaded and installed the latest Firefox for Linux (version 145) from Mozilla's site.

Then I noticed at first that it wasn't following my GTK theme. Then after testing a bit, I discovered it would respect only themes with names that end in "-dark". I've taken some screenshots and attached them to demonstrate the problem.

firefox-esr from Debian's repositories didn't have this problem. But also, I've got another computer that still has an older distro (Debian 11) installed, and I'm running the latest firefox 145 on that too, and it always respects my GTK theme regardless of whether its name ends in "-dark". So, perhaps this is a GTK/GTK4 problem or something?

Does anyone know about this issue, can anyone help? I would really like Firefox to respect my choice of theme regardless of whether the theme's name ends with "-dark" or not.
creator: dusthillresident

title: Emojis not visible on macOS Sequoia
content:
I cannot see any emoji on any website (see emojipedia.org's home page as an example, in the attachments). All emojis display as if they were fully transparent; this happens everywhere: in the web page window, in the devtools window and in the search bar. However, Firefox is the only affected app on my system; every other app shows emojis normally.

This also happens in safe mode (I restarted Firefox holding the alt/option key); in fact, I took the screenshots below in safe mode. Disabling the advanced protection on web pages doesn't seem to help either.

I can confirm the `font.name-list.emoji` setting is set to `Apple Color Emoji` (although it does not show as edited, i.e. it's not bold in the `about:config` page).

title: Remove old macOS HD3000 workarounds
content:
Dear Firefox, There are thousands of old Apple computers with OpenCore Legacy Patcher which provides the latest MacOS for these old but capable machines. For example my 2011 Macbook Pro is on macOS Sequoia (version 15). Your removal of HD3000 workarounds broken hardware acceleration of Firefox: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1991812 Affected models:

  • MacBook Pro 2011 13", 15" and 17"
  • MacBook Air 2011 11" and 13"
  • Mac mini 2011 models without Radeon dGPU

https://dortania.github.io/OpenCore-Legacy-Patcher/TROUBLESHOOT-NONMETAL.html#broken-firefox-and-thunderbird-hd-3000

Please, think about putting back these workarounds.

Thank you! Csaba

title: Unable to play udemy.com videos
content:
Hello

I'm facing a frustrating problem. I asked an AI the following:

Firefox Developer Edition (v145.0.2) on Windows 11 host machine can play udemy.com videos but Firefox Developer Edition (v146.0b9) on Windows hyper-v virtual machine cannot.

I suspect the cause is due to either settings or the virtualisation Hyper-V. Other browsers (Edge, Brave) on the virtual machine can play udemy.com videos with no problems.

Gemini said: This is likely caused by a specific change introduced in Firefox Nightly/Beta (v146) regarding how it handles video decoding on Windows.

The Short Answer: Firefox v146 enabled FFmpeg-based hardware video decoding by default on Windows (previously it relied almost exclusively on Windows Media Foundation). This experimental feature often conflicts with the virtualized graphics drivers (Hyper-V Video) used in your VM, causing the player to fail (black screen or error) while audio might still work or the player simply refuses to load.

Is this true?

title: UI Issue with Vertical Tabs
content:
I am a loyal Firefox user and recently started trying out the vertical tabs feature. However, I noticed a significant UI issue: there is a very sharp right angle in the upper-left corner of the web page.

Currently, Firefox employs a rounded-corner UI design overall, and this sharp angle in the upper-left corner looks quite inconsistent, especially since the tab to its left and the address bar above it both feature rounded corners.

Therefore, I kindly request that this issue be addressed in a future update to provide a better visual experience when using vertical tabs.
